li.p: members’ shares should be classified as equity until a member has requested redemption. That member’s share would then be classified as a financial liability and this treatment would be consistent with local laws. Some commentators believe this is a more straightforward approach to classification.

the classification of members’ shares should incorporate the probability that members will request redemption. Those who suggest this view observe that experience shows this probability to be small, usually within 1–5 per cent, for some types of co‑operative. They see no basis for classifying 100 per cent of the members’ shares as liabilities on the basis of the behaviour of 1 per cent.
